page.title: 01DALWHINNIE VILLAGE
page.content: The coordinates 02600783 contain the village of Dalwhinnie in the Badenoch and Strathspey district of the Highland Region. Within this area is a distillery, two hotels, a shop, post office, school, garage and a railway station. The main employment is provided by the distillery and the railway. The River Truim flows alongside the village. Dalwhinnie is the highest village in the Highland Region standing at approximately 1100feet above sea level. It stands on the old A9 midway between Perth and Inverness and was by-passed by the new A9 in 1975. The 1981 Census reported that Dalwhinnie had a population of 119 and there are fewer inhabitants than that today.
